title: Richard Madeley responds to rumours son-in-law James Haskell is set for I'm A Celebrity
text:

TV presenter Richard Madeley has addressed rumours he could enter the I'm A Celebrity 2019 jungle next month.

The former This Morning host, and husband to Judy Finnigan, also reacted to claims his son-in-law James Haskell was taking part.

Speaking on Lorraine on Wednesday morning, he neither confirmed or denied he would be on the show, but appeared to hint that while he wasn't doing it this time around he wouldn't rule it out.

He recently denied claims he would be on the series, but speaking to host Lorraine Kelly he might have had a change of heart.

Grilled on daughter Chloe's husband James also being rumoured, Richard again remained coy without offering a definitive answer.

(Image: ITV)

Asked by Lorraine if he'd take part in the ITV series hosted by Ant and Dec, he said: "Everyone is asking me this.

"Well I dunno, erm, I've done it a couple of times with the other show."

On seeing a picture made up by the show of what he might look like in the jungle outfit, he joked: "I hate it... in that case the answer is no, absolutely not."

Again not saying no, Richard continued: "I've done the companion show a couple of times, and you end up doing a few of the [trials].

"They put me in a coffin underground with snakes but actually I quite like snakes."

He then addressed the rumours about son-in-law James, but hinted he would not be doing the series.

(Image: ITV)

Richard told Lorraine: "If I did know I wouldn't be able to say.

"The last I heard of it... well I spoke to him yesterday. He's in Japan!"

Lorraine then quizzed whether he could make a detour to Australia for the series, with Richard joking it might be the case.

Richard also teased more plans to host This Morning again with wife Judy in the future, after they hosted the ITV daytime series as a one-off this month.

Lorraine airs weekdays at 8:30am on ITV.
description: I'm A Celebrity 2019 line-up rumours include both Richard Madeley and his son-in-law rugby star James Haskell
